text: Welcome to how to cook that.net I am Ann Reardon
Today we are going to make chocolate coated oreos three different
ways of doing that
If you want a pattern on top buy some chocolate transfer sheets
They have a thin layer of coloured cocoa butter on them in a
pattern
Then take a round object and trace around it onto the back of the transfer sheet
and then cut it out.
The first method is using a metal muffin tin, for this
you will need to line your tin with cupcake wrappers.
Place your transfer sheet circles the rough side facing up
into the base of the cupcake wrappers
Take an oreo, drop it into the the melted chocolate make sure it is completely covered
Then using two forks take it out and place it into the cupcake wrapper.
Take a spoonful of extra chocolate
and top up each one to just cover the oreo.
Allow them to set and then take off the papers and peel off the chocolate transfer sheets.
The second way of making them gives a thinner coat of chocolate and is good
for mini oreos or if you are in a hurry.
Place your oreo in the melted chocolate and make sure it is completely covered.
Remove it from the chocolate and place on either a chocolate transfer sheet or a
sheet of baking paper to set.
Allow them to set and then peel them off the transfer sheet  and you're done.
The last method is my favourite one because I think they look the best
we are going to use white chocolate and colour it using oil based colour.
.  Just take a small amount and stir it through.
Again if you want a pattern on them cut out circles from a chocolate transfer sheet
and put in the base of a silicone cupcake tray.
Place a couple of spoons of chocolate into the mold, top with an
oreo, gently push it down and top with more chocolate.  Spread it around until it is
smooth.
Once you have filled them all you can bang the tray on the bench a few times just to
smooth the top.
Allow them to set
and then pop them out of the silicone mold and peel off the transfer sheet.  They look great
on candy buffets and dessert tables.  Make sure you watch the video on how to temper chocolate and what chocolate to use
so that they will not melt at room temperature.
And don't forget to click like and subscribe to this channel there is a new video every week.  Enjoy.
